extracted_data.notes: r. rajat mehta; tycare general hospital
extracted_data.full_text:
Patient ID: P789024 
Name: Neha Verma 
Age: 32 
Gender: Female 
Date of Visit: 2024-08-21 

Symptoms: 
- Severe abdominal pain (lower right quadrant) 
- Nausea and vomiting 
- Low-grade fever (100.2°F) 
- Loss of appetite 

Medical History: 
- No known chronic illnesses 
- No previous abdominal surgeries 
- Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use 

Medications: 
- Paracetamol (self-administered before visit) 

Preliminary Diagnosis: 
- Suspected Acute Appendicitis 

Recommended Tests: 
- Abdominal Ultrasound 
- CBC with differential 
- Urinalysis 

Physician Notes: 
Pain is localized to the lower right abdomen and worsens with movement. Rebound tenderness 
noted on palpation. High suspicion of acute appendicitis—advised imaging and potential 
surgical consultation. 

Signed, 
Dr. Rajat Mehta 
CityCare General Hospital

extracted_data.notes: maging to rule out chronic lung condition.; r. ananya desai
extracted_data.full_text:
Patient ID: P123456 
Name: Rahul Sharma 
Age: 45 
Gender: Male 
Date of Visit: 2024-11-12 

Symptoms: 
- Persistent cough 
- Shortness of breath 
- Mild fever (99.8°F) 
- Fatigue 

Medical History: 
- Hypertension (diagnosed 2017) 
- Type 2 Diabetes (diagnosed 2019) 
- Smoker (quit in 2020) 

Medications: 
- Metformin 500mg (twice daily) 
- Amlodipine 5mg (once daily) 

Preliminary Diagnosis: 
- Suspected Bronchitis 
- Rule out early-stage COPD 

Recommended Tests: 
- Chest X-ray 
- CBC 
- Pulmonary function test (PFT) 

Physician Notes: 
Patient reports increased coughing over the past 2 weeks. Breathlessness on light exertion. No 
recent infections. Vitals within normal range except mild temperature. Suggested pulmonary 
imaging to rule out chronic lung condition. 

Signed, 
Dr. Ananya Desai 
Apollo Multispecialty Clinic
